intro: Cyclosorus × jaculodentatus, commonly known as the hybrid water fern, is a rare and intriguing plant that combines traits from its parent species, Cyclosorus and jaculodentatus. It is a member of the family Marsileaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically divided into four lobes, giving it a delicate, lacy appearance. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, often found in ponds and ditches. Due to its rarity and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
